sevenDaysTour.title: 7-Day Introductory Tour of Turkmenistan
sevenDaysTour.description: This 7-day guided tour will serve as your gateway to one of Central Asia’s most mysterious and unexplored countries – Turkmenistan. Travel through time visiting UNESCO World Heritage sites like Merv and Nisa, marvel at the surreal white architecture of Ashgabat, and witness the otherworldly glow of the Darvaza gas crater in the heart of the Karakum Desert. With rich history and pristine nature, this journey offers a truly authentic cultural experience far from mass tourism.

introduction: Despite its low profile on the global tourism map, Turkmenistan is one of the most fascinating destinations in Central Asia. With a rich historical legacy, surreal modern architecture, and stunning desert landscapes, it offers a unique and authentic travel experience — especially for curious and culturally-driven travelers. Here’s why Turkmenistan is well worth the journey.

darvaza.heading: The Darvaza Gas Crater – A Fiery Phenomenon in the Desert
darvaza.description: Known as the “Door to Hell,” the Darvaza gas crater has been burning continuously since 1971, when Soviet geologists set it alight to prevent the spread of methane gas. Located in the vast Karakum Desert, it’s over 60 meters wide and glows spectacularly at night. Many tours offer overnight camping nearby, giving you the rare chance to witness this dramatic natural fire pit under the stars.

ashgabat.heading: Ashgabat – The Marble-Clad Capital
ashgabat.description: Ashgabat, the capital of Turkmenistan, holds the Guinness World Record for the most white marble buildings of any city in the world. Rebuilt after a massive earthquake in 1948, modern Ashgabat is a surreal showcase of gold-domed monuments, empty six-lane avenues, and high-tech fountains. It’s a fascinating example of post-Soviet urban planning and national identity, and a must-see for lovers of architecture and modern history.

silk_road.heading: Ancient Civilizations and Silk Road Heritage
silk_road.description: Turkmenistan is home to several important archaeological sites from the Silk Road era and beyond.

sites.merv: Merv, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, was once one of the largest cities in the world during the 12th century.
sites.nisa: Nisa, the ancient capital of the Parthian Empire, offers insight into pre-Islamic Central Asia.
sites.konye_urgench: Konye-Urgench in the north features impressive mausoleums and minarets from the Khorezm era.

silk_road.closing: These sites reveal layers of cultural influence — from Zoroastrianism and Buddhism to Islam — and offer a deep historical context for the region.

visaGuide: How to Get a Visa to Turkmenistan: Step-by-Step Guide
description: To visit Turkmenistan, most foreign citizens need a tourist visa. We help you obtain the Letter of Invitation (LOI), which is required to apply. Once you receive the invitation, you can submit your documents at the nearest consulate or get a visa upon arrival at Ashgabat Airport. We guide you through every step to make the process quick and hassle-free.
